newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL -- America Online retreats.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL -- America Online retreats.

text.p: America Online Inc shares slipped one to 37 in early pre-open trade Friday, the stock weakened by the company's report last night of $1.64 per share second quarter loss, including charges, traders said.
The results included an unexpected $24.3 million settlement charge related to an agreement with state attorneys general on subscribers' inability to log on to the service.
Wall Street was expecting a loss of about $0.55 per share, before any restructuring charge, according to First Call. American Online posted a profit of $0.09 per share in the year-ago quarter.
AOL's disappointing earnings will likely excluded the stock from what traders said is expected to be a rebound in the recently-weakened group.
Sparking Friday's expected bounce, they said, are positive comments on the DRAM computer chip sector made by Montgomery Securities.
Helped higher by the outlook were shares in Micron Technology Inc, which climbed to 34-3/8 from 32-7/8 and Applied Materials Inc up 1-3/8 to 49, they said.
International Business Machines Corp also climbed on the DRAM comments, rising to 146-1/4 from 145-5/8.

Intel Corp shares too rallied before Friday's open, climbing 2-1/16 to 155 in heavy third market trade touched off by Hambrecht & Quist's reiteration of a buy recommendation on the stock, traders said.

Among other issues active before the open, MCI Communications Corp firmed, rising to 36-9/16 from 36-1/8, Ascend Communications added 1-3/8 to 66, 3Com fell to 51-5/8 from 52-1/4, Microsoft was up to 98-5/8 from 97-1/8 and Apple Computer added 3/8 to 16-3/8.
